intro: Corethamnium chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan corethra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
